sentences.en: He wrote to the fleet commander to the commandant of the Marine Corps.
sentences.cn: 他曾写给舰队司令,写给海军指挥部的指挥官.

sentences.en: The academy commandant, General Andrew Ritchie, jokingly warned of tough times ahead.
sentences.cn: 军校司令安德鲁.里奇将军打趣说,苦日子还在后面呢.

sentences.en: The academy's commandant, General Andrew Ritchie , jokingly warned of tough times ahead.
sentences.cn: 军校司令安德鲁·奇将军打趣说, 苦日子还在后面呢.

sentences.en: The Commandant has had a rotten day.
sentences.cn: 司令官这一天过得真倒楣.

sentences.en: The commandant has issued an order, which is posted everywhere, declaring that any civilian caught interfering with the railroad, its bridges, tunnels or trains will be summarily hanged.
sentences.cn: 他们的指挥官已下达一项命令，宣布凡妨碍或破坏铁路、铁路桥梁、隧道和火车等军事设施的平民，一旦发现，立即处以绞刑。

sentences.en: The Commandant has nevertheless been compelled to look into the problem.
sentences.cn: 司令官仍然只好把这问题调查一下.

sentences.en: The commandant issues a flat order.
sentences.cn: 司令官发布一道干脆的命令.

words.tran_cn: 指挥的；居高临下的；威风凛凛的
司令官，指挥官；军事学校的校长

trans.tran_cn: 司令官，指挥官，〈美〉（陆军军官学校的）校长
trans.tran_en: the army officer in charge of a place or group of people
